<span key="3484db6fc1204baaaaa0c831f69674c5"><span offset-key="3484db6fc1204baaaaa0c831f69674c5:0"> </span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3484db6fc1204baaaaa0c831f69674c5:1">.</span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3484db6fc1204baaaaa0c831f69674c5:2">execSync</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3484db6fc1204baaaaa0c831f69674c5:3">(</span><span class="r-qtrn9a" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3484db6fc1204baaaaa0c831f69674c5:4">'cat \*'</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3484db6fc1204baaaaa0c831f69674c5:5">)</span></span>

5

<span key="a4b20d25f10142a79adb2606531ea8de"><span offset-key="a4b20d25f10142a79adb2606531ea8de:0"> </span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="a4b20d25f10142a79adb2606531ea8de:1">.</span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="a4b20d25f10142a79adb2606531ea8de:2">toString</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="a4b20d25f10142a79adb2606531ea8de:3">(</span><span class="r-qtrn9a" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="a4b20d25f10142a79adb2606531ea8de:4">'UTF-8'</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="a4b20d25f10142a79adb2606531ea8de:5">);</span></span>

6

<span key="3d69710132794c03a09c0b54dcbbf169"><span offset-key="3d69710132794c03a09c0b54dcbbf169:0">fs</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3d69710132794c03a09c0b54dcbbf169:1">.</span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3d69710132794c03a09c0b54dcbbf169:2">writeFile</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3d69710132794c03a09c0b54dcbbf169:3">(</span><span class="r-qtrn9a" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3d69710132794c03a09c0b54dcbbf169:4">'output.md'</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3d69710132794c03a09c0b54dcbbf169:5">,</span><span offset-key="3d69710132794c03a09c0b54dcbbf169:6"> cat</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3d69710132794c03a09c0b54dcbbf169:7">,</span><span offset-key="3d69710132794c03a09c0b54dcbbf169:8"> </span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3d69710132794c03a09c0b54dcbbf169:9">err</span><span offset-key="3d69710132794c03a09c0b54dcbbf169:10"> </span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3d69710132794c03a09c0b54dcbbf169:11">=></span><span offset-key="3d69710132794c03a09c0b54dcbbf169:12"> </span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="3d69710132794c03a09c0b54dcbbf169:13">{</span></span>

<span key="a62b733d172d4209ad28df81c6db6fc3"><span offset-key="a62b733d172d4209ad28df81c6db6fc3:0"> </span><span class="r-y7gyvo" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="a62b733d172d4209ad28df81c6db6fc3:1">if</span><span offset-key="a62b733d172d4209ad28df81c6db6fc3:2"> </span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="a62b733d172d4209ad28df81c6db6fc3:3">(</span><span offset-key="a62b733d172d4209ad28df81c6db6fc3:4">err</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="a62b733d172d4209ad28df81c6db6fc3:5">)</span><span offset-key="a62b733d172d4209ad28df81c6db6fc3:6"> </span><span class="r-y7gyvo" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="a62b733d172d4209ad28df81c6db6fc3:7">throw</span><span offset-key="a62b733d172d4209ad28df81c6db6fc3:8"> err</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="a62b733d172d4209ad28df81c6db6fc3:9">;</span></span>

###

<span key="da19c14fbf19441eaa93a320158c8e1e"><span offset-key="da19c14fbf19441eaa93a320158c8e1e:0">Description:</span></span>

> <span key="858ba70ee55c46c49efec32b6370b110"><span offset-key="858ba70ee55c46c49efec32b6370b110:0">Notes: ==> sudo apt install wget</span></span>

<span key="4d82c2f9f5f54429ba77e24885b24401">**code:**</span>

#

<span key="177fe567c0dd487896eaea49786052b6"><span offset-key="177fe567c0dd487896eaea49786052b6:0">3. Clean Out Messy Git Repo:</span></span>

###

<span key="04dae4cb68a14fb9b4250ec04863750b"><span offset-key="04dae4cb68a14fb9b4250ec04863750b:0">Description: recursively removes git related folders as well as internal use files / attributions in addition to empty folders</span></span>

> <span key="260c70e96c9343c491709e2149c71dfa"><span offset-key="260c70e96c9343c491709e2149c71dfa:0">Notes: To clear up clutter in repositories that only get used on your local machine.</span></span>

<span key="803f3911eceb4b118f3f017a4b9791fd">**code:**</span>

1

<span key="f5fc7d81145b462ba8915ec0d36ee35c"><span offset-key="f5fc7d81145b462ba8915ec0d36ee35c:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

2

<span key="2619c47aef5e449eae70f97e32dbfa2b"><span offset-key="2619c47aef5e449eae70f97e32dbfa2b:0">find . -empty -type d -print -delete </span></span>

3

<span key="e68945b20ddc4039839d65a6428911e4"><span offset-key="e68945b20ddc4039839d65a6428911e4:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

4

<span key="3f9879658cb5485bb1958a5886aa2c7b"><span offset-key="3f9879658cb5485bb1958a5886aa2c7b:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

5

<span key="cf22998b18284cf6b4465f301b27a472"><span offset-key="cf22998b18284cf6b4465f301b27a472:0">find . \\( -name ".git" -o -name ".gitignore" -o -name ".gitmodules" -o -name ".gitattributes" \\) -exec rm -rf -- {} +</span></span>

6

<span key="494a9b43b6c84ed6a729b5682cdc2e83"><span offset-key="494a9b43b6c84ed6a729b5682cdc2e83:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

7

<span key="893d0cc90e044ec992b651b4ea2b875a"><span offset-key="893d0cc90e044ec992b651b4ea2b875a:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

8

<span key="ec98ee46a2754f0fb30b41f721b3ddab"><span offset-key="ec98ee46a2754f0fb30b41f721b3ddab:0">find . \\( -name "\*SECURITY.txt" -o -name "\*RELEASE.txt" -o -name "\*CHANGELOG.txt" -o -name "\*LICENSE.txt" -o -name "\*CONTRIBUTING.txt" -name "\*HISTORY.md" -o -name "\*LICENSE" -o -name "\*SECURITY.md" -o -name "\*RELEASE.md" -o -name "\*CHANGELOG.md" -o -name "\*LICENSE.md" -o -name "\*CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md" -o -name "\*CONTRIBUTING.md" \\) -exec rm -rf -- {} +</span></span>

<span key="0412b1b9ad0e46c1b25b49eaf0dd578d"><span offset-key="0412b1b9ad0e46c1b25b49eaf0dd578d:0">4. clone all of a user's git repositories</span></span>

###

<span key="9cf62c57684149639bcbb42bfc422994"><span offset-key="9cf62c57684149639bcbb42bfc422994:0">Description: clone all of a user or organization's git repositories.</span></span>

> <span key="e25edd032f6e432b89ae41f6118fa81f"><span offset-key="e25edd032f6e432b89ae41f6118fa81f:0">Notes:</span></span>

<span key="25eb5f96bda54f85bbfb00156bef804e">**code:**</span>

#

<span key="759010c4a0ed476e9a600b035a791f56"><span offset-key="759010c4a0ed476e9a600b035a791f56:0">Generalized:</span></span>

1

<span key="3f7cd414cbd3496ca3ebc1180891404d"><span offset-key="3f7cd414cbd3496ca3ebc1180891404d:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

2

<span key="c7c998c238d840cda63c65340839d1eb"><span offset-key="c7c998c238d840cda63c65340839d1eb:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

3

<span key="dbaa9c8a66284b658043423dda4e7282"><span offset-key="dbaa9c8a66284b658043423dda4e7282:0">CNTX={users|orgs}; NAME={username|orgname}; PAGE=1</span></span>

4

<span key="93962135bb074b699775e9cdfe8c7bb4"><span offset-key="93962135bb074b699775e9cdfe8c7bb4:0">curl "https://api.github.com/$CNTX/$NAME/repos?page=$PAGE&per\_page=100" |</span></span>

5

6

<span key="a8b191a1c6074cf8bdeaa03db6a91d68"><span offset-key="a8b191a1c6074cf8bdeaa03db6a91d68:0"> cut -d \\" -f 4 |</span></span>

#

<span key="0553b9c2ddfd4b7dab7e22b13d92c449"><span offset-key="0553b9c2ddfd4b7dab7e22b13d92c449:0">6. Recursive Unzip In Place</span></span>

###

<span key="c13e246eeee14a11afa4222c2d9e37c4"><span offset-key="c13e246eeee14a11afa4222c2d9e37c4:0">Description: recursively unzips folders and then deletes the zip file by the same name.</span></span>

> <span key="7d62b9f44c754d0280bbd6a326b39454"><span offset-key="7d62b9f44c754d0280bbd6a326b39454:0">Notes:</span></span>

<span key="358a5025dbf64260b180b006b7413d2f">**code:**</span>

1

<span key="552cbd7e31c04fbea444931a50c751e6"><span offset-key="552cbd7e31c04fbea444931a50c751e6:0">find . -name "\*.zip" | while read filename; do unzip -o -d "\`dirname "$filename"\`" "$filename"; done;</span></span>

2

<span key="62fbf110635f4119bc6048b459ea6fa5"><span offset-key="62fbf110635f4119bc6048b459ea6fa5:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

5

#

<span key="da79bfded0764568ba42344597e8d269"><span offset-key="da79bfded0764568ba42344597e8d269:0">13. Find & Replace string in file & folder names recursively..</span></span>

###

<span key="253abdc795dd42d8b719d597576fbe04"><span offset-key="253abdc795dd42d8b719d597576fbe04:0">Description:</span></span>

> <span key="8e73255494e94d86aa8467147764799d"><span offset-key="8e73255494e94d86aa8467147764799d:0">Notes:</span></span>

<span key="cb268299f0184945a92c56b621b1ce8b"><span offset-key="cb268299f0184945a92c56b621b1ce8b:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

<span key="8fd4100c4d9c44269e1eef7a50daaa8c"><span offset-key="8fd4100c4d9c44269e1eef7a50daaa8c:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

<span key="b70ece41f58f41d9b9ec00d802a9d2dc"><span offset-key="b70ece41f58f41d9b9ec00d802a9d2dc:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

<span key="6e301116b91a46a9a31e15b17037c1c6"><span offset-key="6e301116b91a46a9a31e15b17037c1c6:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

#

<span key="16b9921bc4fb43b9bd919e9fbd67d46b"><span offset-key="16b9921bc4fb43b9bd919e9fbd67d46b:0">20. Remove duplicate lines from a text file</span></span>

###

<span key="f530b342520443bc88993ee7e91971fb"><span offset-key="f530b342520443bc88993ee7e91971fb:0">Description:</span></span>

> <span key="a678c6561cbf42f598902839c9a565c0"><span offset-key="a678c6561cbf42f598902839c9a565c0:0">Notes: //...syntax of uniq...// $uniq \[OPTION\] \[INPUT\[OUTPUT\]\] The syntax of this is quite easy to understand. Here, INPUT refers to the input file in which repeated lines need to be filtered out and if INPUT isn’t specified then uniq reads from the standard input. OUTPUT refers to the output file in which you can store the filtered output generated by uniq command and as in case of INPUT if OUTPUT isn’t specified then uniq writes to the standard output.</span></span>

<span key="d2f1c4b2db9245cb819ff2c2bb6e82b0"><span offset-key="d2f1c4b2db9245cb819ff2c2bb6e82b0:0">Now, let’s understand the use of this with the help of an example. Suppose you have a text file named kt.txt which contains repeated lines that needs to be omitted. This can simply be done with uniq.</span></span>

<span key="779d7da4417745beb5ac4e33412f7b36">**code:**</span>

1

<span key="e37d72308d8c4d7b8f68604b44cdccf9"><span offset-key="e37d72308d8c4d7b8f68604b44cdccf9:0">sudo apt install uniq</span></span>

2

<span key="d6ac4d70a8144145a5b5576f1ad04beb"><span offset-key="d6ac4d70a8144145a5b5576f1ad04beb:0">uniq -u input.txt output.txt</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="c5e4c41b3749496cb70a11dfd9bf7655"><span offset-key="c5e4c41b3749496cb70a11dfd9bf7655:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

#

<span key="da9874cd65534131ae0ab6157d900d37"><span offset-key="da9874cd65534131ae0ab6157d900d37:0">21. Remove lines containing string:</span></span>

#

<span key="5974e88c6b214f3a803289507d6c566f"><span offset-key="5974e88c6b214f3a803289507d6c566f:0">25. Index of Iframes</span></span>

###

<span key="d64dd49b8ffb43a2927cdfd57e1d08ce"><span offset-key="d64dd49b8ffb43a2927cdfd57e1d08ce:0">Description: Creates an index.html file that contains all the files in the working directory or any of it's sub folders as iframes instead of anchor tags.</span></span>

> <span key="c24bf0ba9b1248b8ae8ecef31b3fff41"><span offset-key="c24bf0ba9b1248b8ae8ecef31b3fff41:0">Notes: Useful Follow up Code:</span></span>

#

<span key="8c34b672f1654f61aaace8351fb5f44c"><span offset-key="8c34b672f1654f61aaace8351fb5f44c:0">27. OVERWRITE LOCAL CHANGES:</span></span>

###

<span key="33bed4fd9a974afa8359a14e3d567a9a"><span offset-key="33bed4fd9a974afa8359a14e3d567a9a:0">Description:</span></span>

<span key="aac4680bbdfa438f964f79d26ee3c98e"><span offset-key="aac4680bbdfa438f964f79d26ee3c98e:0">Important: If you have any local changes, they will be lost. With or without --hard option, any local commits that haven't been pushed will be lost.\[\*\] If you have any files that are not tracked by Git (e.g. uploaded user content), these files will not be affected.</span></span>

> <span key="ee26e9cc68d4474681b2ef07a1c59bea"><span offset-key="ee26e9cc68d4474681b2ef07a1c59bea:0">Notes: First, run a fetch to update all origin/ refs to latest:</span></span>

<span key="34e64ca2dc2043089b87c8d32d88bebd">**code:**</span>

1

<span key="6e5c58a0921c4a969b9f6a9d75865927"><span offset-key="6e5c58a0921c4a969b9f6a9d75865927:0">git fetch --all</span></span>

2

<span key="1ddfe75de2c44f26b420e6cbe46975bb"><span offset-key="1ddfe75de2c44f26b420e6cbe46975bb:0"># Backup your current branch:</span></span>

3

<span key="043a0956b6b54a49a124b65f9b92b3fa"><span offset-key="043a0956b6b54a49a124b65f9b92b3fa:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

4

<span key="8b4014ff54dc49cab2d4b7b6bf687577"><span offset-key="8b4014ff54dc49cab2d4b7b6bf687577:0">git branch backup-master</span></span>

5

<span key="3caa5adc07b645b190bd5d1a562aa8ca"><span offset-key="3caa5adc07b645b190bd5d1a562aa8ca:0"># Then, you have two options:</span></span>

6

<span key="e9f8ee8c9d924da096c8cd04ad294b3b"><span offset-key="e9f8ee8c9d924da096c8cd04ad294b3b:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

7

<span key="3ad45a581072421d83194981c155ba15"><span offset-key="3ad45a581072421d83194981c155ba15:0">git reset --hard origin/master</span></span>

8

<span key="4bc306a5ab2f441991c2b9235a0c054a"><span offset-key="4bc306a5ab2f441991c2b9235a0c054a:0"># OR If you are on some other branch:</span></span>

9

<span key="31d3be318f4644d9b341430e4f41f9df"><span offset-key="31d3be318f4644d9b341430e4f41f9df:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

10

<span key="ddbbc2db404b4293b44b6c91def8f285"><span offset-key="ddbbc2db404b4293b44b6c91def8f285:0">git reset --hard origin/&lt;branch_name></span></span>

11

<span key="398c59817ef64cc08153f3b6251185fb"><span offset-key="398c59817ef64cc08153f3b6251185fb:0"># Explanation:</span></span>

12

<span key="00bca17d71d443099dba9b79b37f3c6a"><span offset-key="00bca17d71d443099dba9b79b37f3c6a:0"># git fetch downloads the latest from remote without trying to merge or rebase anything.</span></span>

13

<span key="052b00d171c549e3b4a785815a3a2e24"><span offset-key="052b00d171c549e3b4a785815a3a2e24:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

14

<span key="f5fcbd2c69844a0cb426cae4c2809921"><span offset-key="f5fcbd2c69844a0cb426cae4c2809921:0"># Then the git reset resets the master branch to what you just fetched. The --hard option changes all the files in your working tree to match the files in origin/master</span></span>

15

<span key="d7f82998be5f4dd2ae78fe2dcf8113bc"><span offset-key="d7f82998be5f4dd2ae78fe2dcf8113bc:0">git fetch --all</span></span>

16

<span key="9d1309f5d47548af9af84137f295e0fd"><span offset-key="9d1309f5d47548af9af84137f295e0fd:0">git reset --hard origin/master</span></span>

#

<span key="3ec7da36695945709d54d0f7e68f1707"><span offset-key="3ec7da36695945709d54d0f7e68f1707:0">28. Remove Submodules:</span></span>

###

<span key="2a62e1d76373458faa5cca69a90c9d60"><span offset-key="2a62e1d76373458faa5cca69a90c9d60:0">Description: To remove a submodule you need to:</span></span>

> <span key="14cd192658ed4aef8626ba8648f47d81"><span offset-key="14cd192658ed4aef8626ba8648f47d81:0">Notes:</span></span>

> <span key="7f792d98939144ff8530ad69b5215920"><span offset-key="7f792d98939144ff8530ad69b5215920:0">Delete the relevant section from the .gitmodules file. Stage the .gitmodules changes git add .gitmodules Delete the relevant section from .git/config. Run git rm --cached path_to_submodule (no trailing slash). Run rm -rf .git/modules/path_to_submodule (no trailing slash). Commit git commit -m "Removed submodule " Delete the now untracked submodule files rm -rf path_to_submodule</span></span>

<span key="915693b4eb57447eb91159bb256b4483">**code:**</span>

1

<span key="6dcffa4373b94c8489c9b761a8a88658"><span offset-key="6dcffa4373b94c8489c9b761a8a88658:0">git submodule deinit</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

<span key="eb2ca742585b49219cef073b23bfe14b"><span offset-key="eb2ca742585b49219cef073b23bfe14b:0">32. Undo recent pull request:</span></span>

###

<span key="191258c853394b47acd60f783e4913ac"><span offset-key="191258c853394b47acd60f783e4913ac:0">Description:</span></span>

> <span key="16022a786515464086f8688a022654fc"><span offset-key="16022a786515464086f8688a022654fc:0">Notes:</span></span>

<span key="4ce9a6d31a6d4fe3af1db0a710a13b51">**code:**</span>

1

#

<span key="8e2350c976154fc282c8722043bef946"><span offset-key="8e2350c976154fc282c8722043bef946:0">39. Remove string from file names recursively</span></span>

###

<span key="468c8087d6844818a16eb00bb0752b90"><span offset-key="468c8087d6844818a16eb00bb0752b90:0">Description: In the example below I am using this command to remove the string "-master" from all file names in the working directory and all of it's sub directories.</span></span>

<span key="8aedeb296ccc401eb4603ac589d3c8b2">**code:**</span>

1

<span key="8fb83de36c9c4b1d9f11cf6a4f646c79"><span offset-key="8fb83de36c9c4b1d9f11cf6a4f646c79:0">find &lt;mydir> -type f -exec sed -i 's/&lt;string1>/&lt;string2>/g' {} +</span></span>

2

<span key="6ea49e12a826478d9c1d2020f619a9a8"><span offset-key="6ea49e12a826478d9c1d2020f619a9a8:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

3

<span key="89da980a2db9471198725c32ea7a7055"><span offset-key="89da980a2db9471198725c32ea7a7055:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

4

<span key="a1a16a5b5c5d4906ad368e3ea8375fb9"><span offset-key="a1a16a5b5c5d4906ad368e3ea8375fb9:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

5

<span key="0d4f0dc4be1b421cb77b972b94a02111"><span offset-key="0d4f0dc4be1b421cb77b972b94a02111:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

6

<span key="813b75b821fc41c2b1e3c2aeffdb550a"><span offset-key="813b75b821fc41c2b1e3c2aeffdb550a:0">find . -type f -exec rename 's/-master//g' {} +</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

> <span key="f3cf7dcab5cd414f92541407d833578b"><span offset-key="f3cf7dcab5cd414f92541407d833578b:0">Notes: The same could be done for folder names by changing the </span>_-type f_<span offset-key="f3cf7dcab5cd414f92541407d833578b:2"> flag (for file) to a </span>_-type d_<span offset-key="f3cf7dcab5cd414f92541407d833578b:4"> flag (for directory)</span></span>

1

<span key="35e6bd71e084470a964499cd772693b9"><span offset-key="35e6bd71e084470a964499cd772693b9:0">find &lt;mydir> -type d -exec sed -i 's/&lt;string1>/&lt;string2>/g' {} +</span></span>

2

<span key="6953b3d42fb642d98a34ac7f529cb8ba"><span offset-key="6953b3d42fb642d98a34ac7f529cb8ba:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

3

<span key="5a610cc1f0874440acc149bc4bdcb497"><span offset-key="5a610cc1f0874440acc149bc4bdcb497:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

4

<span key="bda152abcac2420d8a7e3ecdb15d7d86"><span offset-key="bda152abcac2420d8a7e3ecdb15d7d86:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

5

<span key="4d23c059c95c4e9a8aec8eea020b974b"><span offset-key="4d23c059c95c4e9a8aec8eea020b974b:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

6

<span key="4b427a9d03c8432f964695056dea71c5"><span offset-key="4b427a9d03c8432f964695056dea71c5:0">find . -type d -exec rename 's/-master//g' {} +</span></span>

<span key="238b30f002f642b2a130c0110a9c61c8"><span offset-key="238b30f002f642b2a130c0110a9c61c8:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

#

<span key="6e37e98bb543433ab76e60bbda4bc47f"><span offset-key="6e37e98bb543433ab76e60bbda4bc47f:0">40. Remove spaces from file and folder names recursively</span></span>

###

<span key="f3381a97916642b9a467607fdccf9ac1"><span offset-key="f3381a97916642b9a467607fdccf9ac1:0">Description: replaces spaces in file and folder names with an </span>`_`<span offset-key="f3381a97916642b9a467607fdccf9ac1:2"> underscore</span></span>

> <span key="eb0ec9736b984d45ae2b7071474c23ac"><span offset-key="eb0ec9736b984d45ae2b7071474c23ac:0">Notes: need to run </span>`sudo apt install rename`<span offset-key="eb0ec9736b984d45ae2b7071474c23ac:2"> to use this command</span></span>

<span key="fb540e769b9e4c8fa67a60c262d87daf">**code:**</span>

1

<span key="122ba13eb0aa4c6281758e4dc3e89dd8"><span offset-key="122ba13eb0aa4c6281758e4dc3e89dd8:0">find . -name "\* \*" -type d | rename 's/ /\_/g' </span></span>

2

<span key="67fd3abc5e2c4c0bbf4f38034dcdf35b"><span offset-key="67fd3abc5e2c4c0bbf4f38034dcdf35b:0">find . -name "\* \*" -type f | rename 's/ /\_/g'</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="4197c60d5488451681c2020368ad2617"><span offset-key="4197c60d5488451681c2020368ad2617:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

#

<span key="196c2f0bae144391b8ba7f9a71a79a38"><span offset-key="196c2f0bae144391b8ba7f9a71a79a38:0">41. Zip Each subdirectories in a given directory into their own zip file</span></span>

###

<span key="caecac6d008e49129eea9c9abc6e036c"><span offset-key="caecac6d008e49129eea9c9abc6e036c:0">Description:</span></span>

> <span key="5f7dc69d04da47a59ee7d1325a3ceb5b"><span offset-key="5f7dc69d04da47a59ee7d1325a3ceb5b:0">Notes:</span></span>

<span key="3fcf07b9667a4ec7a2e06f719235da3d">**code:**</span>

1

<span key="edb5d510bc10481cbd15d85b99d3b8e4"><span offset-key="edb5d510bc10481cbd15d85b99d3b8e4:0">for i in \*/; do zip -r "${i%/}.zip" "$i"; done</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="6196d631bf3d4041a413236b0773d381"><span offset-key="6196d631bf3d4041a413236b0773d381:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

#

<span key="38c77ec89d224ab7a368b246d8ad1db4"><span offset-key="38c77ec89d224ab7a368b246d8ad1db4:0">98.</span></span>

###

<span key="5b91d59214644383ab020072056be02e"><span offset-key="5b91d59214644383ab020072056be02e:0">Description:</span></span>

> <span key="fba6d3e4bb8d4e578d523c7ba9404ee5"><span offset-key="fba6d3e4bb8d4e578d523c7ba9404ee5:0">Notes:</span></span>

<span key="d44d203198ac403bbd9c9fb927c0afc9">**code:**</span>

1

<span key="6608b6af2fc94e0d8b2be90113e2c34e"><span offset-key="6608b6af2fc94e0d8b2be90113e2c34e:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

#

<span key="f3d2897039ba4f66a218b5b5fb29e828"><span offset-key="f3d2897039ba4f66a218b5b5fb29e828:0">99. Cheat Sheet</span></span>

###

<span key="09528db0554e4f7bbaf65d32d11c45ed"><span offset-key="09528db0554e4f7bbaf65d32d11c45ed:0">Description:</span></span>

> <span key="9f6267e27c9b424e9b9d053cce4fa591"><span offset-key="9f6267e27c9b424e9b9d053cce4fa591:0">Notes:</span></span>

<span key="d30dee62ef36453aa8899f2ea0853d2d">**code:**</span>

1

<span key="3393e262f4904394b8ad277389677453"><span offset-key="3393e262f4904394b8ad277389677453:0">#!/bin/bash</span></span>

2

<span key="80956a1046fd4059ba0143f36c282d92"><span offset-key="80956a1046fd4059ba0143f36c282d92:0">##############################################################################</span></span>

3

<span key="37807ac0e5584b90b65478aff6a040da"><span offset-key="37807ac0e5584b90b65478aff6a040da:0"># SHORTCUTS and HISTORY</span></span>

4

<span key="56f610e0a0d8449eb09260a7b498011e"><span offset-key="56f610e0a0d8449eb09260a7b498011e:0">##############################################################################</span></span>

5

<span key="434ebf0715744d608c55e962aa6453e7"><span offset-key="434ebf0715744d608c55e962aa6453e7:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

6

<span key="493ba1f60dca4d60b9e4c43cde60a7cb"><span offset-key="493ba1f60dca4d60b9e4c43cde60a7cb:0">CTRL+A # move to beginning of line</span></span>

7

<span key="03392f17a7b44241b5415fa8b795b6c6"><span offset-key="03392f17a7b44241b5415fa8b795b6c6:0">CTRL+B # moves backward one character</span></span>

8

<span key="e4df502afcee40eeb1049790f8919c51"><span offset-key="e4df502afcee40eeb1049790f8919c51:0">CTRL+C # halts the current command</span></span>

9

<span key="614538c81d0a4eb6bea0fbdfe2ccb1c7"><span offset-key="614538c81d0a4eb6bea0fbdfe2ccb1c7:0">CTRL+D # deletes one character backward or logs out of current session, similar to exit</span></span>

10

<span key="2fba6197e1a744ab834eb197cdd3807c"><span offset-key="2fba6197e1a744ab834eb197cdd3807c:0">CTRL+E # moves to end of line</span></span>

11

<span key="1293ac9cb7bc4c068482499f46931bc0"><span offset-key="1293ac9cb7bc4c068482499f46931bc0:0">CTRL+F # moves forward one character</span></span>

12

<span key="331e4456260b46fca3ed7acbda412b89"><span offset-key="331e4456260b46fca3ed7acbda412b89:0">CTRL+G # aborts the current editing command and ring the terminal bell</span></span>

13

<span key="64ebca84e59142598b33c17d28c1b504"><span offset-key="64ebca84e59142598b33c17d28c1b504:0">CTRL+H # deletes one character under cursor (same as DELETE)</span></span>

14

<span key="80f9908817df4e9689efbf810ff41ab1"><span offset-key="80f9908817df4e9689efbf810ff41ab1:0">CTRL+J # same as RETURN</span></span>

15

<span key="f48a70c6bd8f4b55aa511f2c8b162e2a"><span offset-key="f48a70c6bd8f4b55aa511f2c8b162e2a:0">CTRL+K # deletes (kill) forward to end of line</span></span>

16

<span key="269f5aa4b92d4b939a5aacf337c11c69"><span offset-key="269f5aa4b92d4b939a5aacf337c11c69:0">CTRL+L # clears screen and redisplay the line</span></span>

17

<span key="437da103bc304b39817b74db79b48a2f"><span offset-key="437da103bc304b39817b74db79b48a2f:0">CTRL+M # same as RETURN</span></span>

18

<span key="4deb4d91f98d412992ffac72b6fd9ad5"><span offset-key="4deb4d91f98d412992ffac72b6fd9ad5:0">CTRL+N # next line in command history</span></span>

19

<span key="0f300c627e284261ae5e2ee4c9e44132"><span offset-key="0f300c627e284261ae5e2ee4c9e44132:0">CTRL+O # same as RETURN, then displays next line in history file</span></span>

20

<span key="3de5fba373d24c50b0c31fb6edf37365"><span offset-key="3de5fba373d24c50b0c31fb6edf37365:0">CTRL+P # previous line in command history</span></span>

21

<span key="d3335aa27fc1437cbf0d8bbadce9bd58"><span offset-key="d3335aa27fc1437cbf0d8bbadce9bd58:0">CTRL+Q # resumes suspended shell output</span></span>

22

<span key="e30845e4870044f7b0cc2547d4928d3d"><span offset-key="e30845e4870044f7b0cc2547d4928d3d:0">CTRL+R # searches backward</span></span>

23

<span key="e17e22ff1bfb40f5a2701e4bf4581426"><span offset-key="e17e22ff1bfb40f5a2701e4bf4581426:0">CTRL+S # searches forward or suspends shell output</span></span>

24

<span key="7d9ddbc085d84f0ca7a5d233bb6d31ea"><span offset-key="7d9ddbc085d84f0ca7a5d233bb6d31ea:0">CTRL+T # transposes two characters</span></span>

25

<span key="bc04ac4b16e647d9932281cc44457f3a"><span offset-key="bc04ac4b16e647d9932281cc44457f3a:0">CTRL+U # kills backward from point to the beginning of line</span></span>

26

<span key="c23eea85dd2f41c2bb2ec584db2ac8a3"><span offset-key="c23eea85dd2f41c2bb2ec584db2ac8a3:0">CTRL+V # makes the next character typed verbatim</span></span>

27

<span key="e353f5f669124f7fa890f232c4f76f58"><span offset-key="e353f5f669124f7fa890f232c4f76f58:0">CTRL+W # kills the word behind the cursor</span></span>

28

<span key="7903a1c604e44cc3b4d3250eecaf1546"><span offset-key="7903a1c604e44cc3b4d3250eecaf1546:0">CTRL+X # lists the possible filename completions of the current word</span></span>

29

<span key="c4949230bbcb46b8ba354ed8e7c80b97"><span offset-key="c4949230bbcb46b8ba354ed8e7c80b97:0">CTRL+Y # retrieves (yank) last item killed</span></span>

30

<span key="d7515f547d8643dfadf6e8a30170ad07"><span offset-key="d7515f547d8643dfadf6e8a30170ad07:0">CTRL+Z # stops the current command, resume with fg in the foreground or bg in the background</span></span>

31

<span key="a9bf7caeb2684e97a51e5bb1f2c237c8"><span offset-key="a9bf7caeb2684e97a51e5bb1f2c237c8:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

32

<span key="4116efc7ea2b4875bd24859d4c509112"><span offset-key="4116efc7ea2b4875bd24859d4c509112:0">ALT+B # moves backward one word</span></span>

33

<span key="f4ee1a95a42a4c2584adf611df27a94c"><span offset-key="f4ee1a95a42a4c2584adf611df27a94c:0">ALT+D # deletes next word</span></span>

34

<span key="bccb004a19c449c38dfa014a9b5ec583"><span offset-key="bccb004a19c449c38dfa014a9b5ec583:0">ALT+F # moves forward one word</span></span>

35

<span key="aa30008d21294aabac436f07be803101"><span offset-key="aa30008d21294aabac436f07be803101:0">ALT+H # deletes one character backward</span></span>

36

<span key="184f7a71b6e44afe8162d75416ea9118"><span offset-key="184f7a71b6e44afe8162d75416ea9118:0">ALT+T # transposes two words</span></span>

37

<span key="7bcbee4f1ebe4bf18e7e941a8bdf3abd"><span offset-key="7bcbee4f1ebe4bf18e7e941a8bdf3abd:0">ALT+. # pastes last word from the last command. Pressing it repeatedly traverses through command history.</span></span>

38

<span key="ef0409030b1e49d9bddcc2b81305be1a"><span offset-key="ef0409030b1e49d9bddcc2b81305be1a:0">ALT+U # capitalizes every character from the current cursor position to the end of the word</span></span>

39

<span key="0603f0f032654bc1a54d250d8a06ca91"><span offset-key="0603f0f032654bc1a54d250d8a06ca91:0">ALT+L # uncapitalizes every character from the current cursor position to the end of the word</span></span>

40

<span key="ff2684c44e46471887c3e0498c7151be"><span offset-key="ff2684c44e46471887c3e0498c7151be:0">ALT+C # capitalizes the letter under the cursor. The cursor then moves to the end of the word.</span></span>

41

<span key="f1a6eaff807d43deb00cbb85d3c14dd4"><span offset-key="f1a6eaff807d43deb00cbb85d3c14dd4:0">ALT+R # reverts any changes to a command you’ve pulled from your history if you’ve edited it.</span></span>

42

<span key="5b35aba4eea843319708243e97a5bc65"><span offset-key="5b35aba4eea843319708243e97a5bc65:0">ALT+? # list possible completions to what is typed</span></span>

43

<span key="b180cd7dcd2c4d428ed3ad5dee96341d"><span offset-key="b180cd7dcd2c4d428ed3ad5dee96341d:0">ALT+^ # expand line to most recent match from history</span></span>

44

<span key="05a378ca2fec4bc6b6d4c63d5f8adea3"><span offset-key="05a378ca2fec4bc6b6d4c63d5f8adea3:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

45

<span key="b8b4cbf18fb948ee97accab38ada1a5e"><span offset-key="b8b4cbf18fb948ee97accab38ada1a5e:0">CTRL+X then ( # start recording a keyboard macro</span></span>

46

<span key="1951b5059e6948e683cf0945c1df9f61"><span offset-key="1951b5059e6948e683cf0945c1df9f61:0">CTRL+X then ) # finish recording keyboard macro</span></span>

47

<span key="7ca3fda4e5b44ce7974111979c100e62"><span offset-key="7ca3fda4e5b44ce7974111979c100e62:0">CTRL+X then E # recall last recorded keyboard macro</span></span>

48

<span key="af6d11e0b6ac4206b65f16ac823fd63e"><span offset-key="af6d11e0b6ac4206b65f16ac823fd63e:0">CTRL+X then CTRL+E # invoke text editor (specified by $EDITOR) on current command line then execute resultes as shell commands</span></span>

49

<span key="72f908de4be4469289c08a579d01c18c"><span offset-key="72f908de4be4469289c08a579d01c18c:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

50

<span key="7776268adb17433c9cfa4098cd9c6927"><span offset-key="7776268adb17433c9cfa4098cd9c6927:0">BACKSPACE # deletes one character backward</span></span>

51

<span key="eccefa0de9824d3eaa83354d2efc8d7c"><span offset-key="eccefa0de9824d3eaa83354d2efc8d7c:0">DELETE # deletes one character under cursor</span></span>

52

<span key="8bdab3b931cc4c3d8341d768864654f0"><span offset-key="8bdab3b931cc4c3d8341d768864654f0:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

53

<span key="756ae9bb8e82401dacb09c57f9bb1915"><span offset-key="756ae9bb8e82401dacb09c57f9bb1915:0">history # shows command line history</span></span>

54

<span key="1afd4d30321a4aca87fefd9ac8ee4d2a"><span offset-key="1afd4d30321a4aca87fefd9ac8ee4d2a:0">!! # repeats the last command</span></span>

55

<span key="caa72420a1374c00bb2317afc0e567e9"><span offset-key="caa72420a1374c00bb2317afc0e567e9:0">!&lt;n> # refers to command line 'n'</span></span>

56

<span key="b77005fe1b6f4f4a8edb8ec5a906f09d"><span offset-key="b77005fe1b6f4f4a8edb8ec5a906f09d:0">!&lt;string> # refers to command starting with 'string'</span></span>

57

<span key="aaaba50ed34f4bb28853de975d5c25c7"><span offset-key="aaaba50ed34f4bb28853de975d5c25c7:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

58

<span key="53cdd7ed7b7a4c88847b021a1c4e7111"><span offset-key="53cdd7ed7b7a4c88847b021a1c4e7111:0">exit # logs out of current session</span></span>

59

<span key="d5480c369f0848baa8e74788188b3af9"><span offset-key="d5480c369f0848baa8e74788188b3af9:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

60

<span key="353c54dfbb824202b83e8094af2d8d1d"><span offset-key="353c54dfbb824202b83e8094af2d8d1d:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

61

<span key="64c7734c9b56442ea2b40214a9accd2f"><span offset-key="64c7734c9b56442ea2b40214a9accd2f:0">##############################################################################</span></span>

62

<span key="bac035a798c54c7bac66d4aad084b3a1"><span offset-key="bac035a798c54c7bac66d4aad084b3a1:0"># BASH BASICS</span></span>

63

<span key="03ea2da810804925bfd9ac4b4543b944"><span offset-key="03ea2da810804925bfd9ac4b4543b944:0">##############################################################################</span></span>

64

<span key="1332614600794f0abef254beed3dd711"><span offset-key="1332614600794f0abef254beed3dd711:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

65

<span key="9e8be8025b814471a0494d2d7fda2ae2"><span offset-key="9e8be8025b814471a0494d2d7fda2ae2:0">env # displays all environment variables</span></span>

66

<span key="3874948b399d4ddc9aeb17f15d599254"><span offset-key="3874948b399d4ddc9aeb17f15d599254:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

67

<span key="5e320c2eea724a948860340544fa8b6b"><span offset-key="5e320c2eea724a948860340544fa8b6b:0">echo $SHELL # displays the shell you're using</span></span>

68

<span key="e5950281947c4d06a434edbab9b8fcba"><span offset-key="e5950281947c4d06a434edbab9b8fcba:0">echo $BASH_VERSION # displays bash version</span></span>

69

<span key="ceb67324360d4109b2567a5ce602c972"><span offset-key="ceb67324360d4109b2567a5ce602c972:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

70

<span key="c64b71de89574d06ba3169b3ca424c1b"><span offset-key="c64b71de89574d06ba3169b3ca424c1b:0">bash # if you want to use bash (type exit to go back to your previously opened shell)</span></span>

71

<span key="c23d4562fdfe43df8c3392439080d8b4"><span offset-key="c23d4562fdfe43df8c3392439080d8b4:0">whereis bash # locates the binary, source and manual-page for a command</span></span>

72

<span key="a1f555cde4cf4ceebb15f6bdd0bac733"><span offset-key="a1f555cde4cf4ceebb15f6bdd0bac733:0">which bash # finds out which program is executed as 'bash' (default: /bin/bash, can change across environments)</span></span>

73

<span key="42467f5176c8476789a5421345a98c6c"><span offset-key="42467f5176c8476789a5421345a98c6c:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

74

<span key="c42eacea59974039b6041fb259f66be8"><span offset-key="c42eacea59974039b6041fb259f66be8:0">clear # clears content on window (hide displayed lines)</span></span>

75

<span key="9c09c5fd39244289ad5036dea2db58e9"><span offset-key="9c09c5fd39244289ad5036dea2db58e9:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

76

77

<span key="a5d22e8c064a4a518306a28a5a547df6"><span offset-key="a5d22e8c064a4a518306a28a5a547df6:0">-N file # file was modified since it was last read</span></span>

<span key="45c5b25d05ff4d9986a1289d8cfb3583"><span offset-key="45c5b25d05ff4d9986a1289d8cfb3583:0">file1 -nt file2 # file1 is newer than file2</span></span>

<span key="db63b32617bd4503978031883d3cc02f"><span offset-key="db63b32617bd4503978031883d3cc02f:0"># The default order for command lookup is functions, followed by built-ins, with scripts and executables last.</span></span>

351

<span key="15e2c15603f240aa8e0f078b4fc67e16"><span offset-key="15e2c15603f240aa8e0f078b4fc67e16:0"># There are three built-ins that you can use to override this order: \`command\`, \`builtin\` and \`enable\`.</span></span>

<span key="43e8e87c31da4cf7ab3cde7a264721d5"><span offset-key="43e8e87c31da4cf7ab3cde7a264721d5:0"># To suspend a job, type CTRL+Z while it is running. You can also suspend a job with CTRL+Y.</span></span>

395

<span key="9d301cb7578c437586abdd35e3ba5597"><span offset-key="9d301cb7578c437586abdd35e3ba5597:0"># This is slightly different from CTRL+Z in that the process is only stopped when it attempts to read input from terminal.</span></span>

<span key="5616fc56c188450f8bd6ae5b3b5c9d79"><span offset-key="5616fc56c188450f8bd6ae5b3b5c9d79:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

544

<span key="db3ef1d330f94e5cae97fa06ab35d704"><span offset-key="db3ef1d330f94e5cae97fa06ab35d704:0"># Example of usage</span></span>

545

<span key="544b83ec34d548ffaf1c32f4838dabfb"><span offset-key="544b83ec34d548ffaf1c32f4838dabfb:0">echo -e "${Green}This is GREEN text${Color_Off} and normal text"</span></span>

546

<span key="0e0e394ed7784bf6aa8b6d65cef8fa33"><span offset-key="0e0e394ed7784bf6aa8b6d65cef8fa33:0">echo -e "${Red}${On_White}This is Red test on White background${Color_Off}" </span></span>

547

<span key="077905c9aed64228a70088ba3db3ec69"><span offset-key="077905c9aed64228a70088ba3db3ec69:0"># option -e is mandatory, it enable interpretation of backslash escapes</span></span>

548
